Class ASImgBars

java.lang.Object
  




public class ASImgBars
extends greenfoot.Actor

ASImgBars is a Greenfoot Actor that serves the purpose of informing a user of stats. Stats currently include how many lives or mana points a user has. The bar with images on top is designed for a 600 * 400 pixels scenario.

The stats are displayed through the use of images.

Hearts represent lives and potions represent mana.

Version:
Sept 2014
Author:
Ahrenn Sivananthan

Constructor Detail

ASImgBars

public ASImgBars(int numLives,
                 double imgHeight)
Constructs a bar that displays number of lives using hearts. Initializes the values for lives and image height as well.

Parameters:
numLives - The user sets the value for max lives to 15 here.
imgHeight - The user sets the value for heart height to 32.0 here.

ASImgBars

public ASImgBars(int numMana,
                 int imgHeight)
Constructs a bar that displays amount of mana using potions. Initializes the values for mana and image height as well.

Parameters:
numMana - The user sets the value for max mana to 15 here.
imgHeight - The user sets the value for potion height to 32 here.
Method Detail

updateDecrease

public int updateDecrease(double manaDown)
Checks to see if current amount of mana is above zero so that decreasing mana will change nothing if mana is equal to zero. If mana is above zero then the amount of mana can and will be decreased (by specified amount) upon running of method. Runs updateImageTwo() method to reconfigure number of potions to match amount of mana.

Parameters:
manaDown - Needs to be inputted when running the method. Determines how much mana to subtract.
Returns:
int Returns amount of mana as an integer (after subtraction), otherwise returns 0.

updateDecrease

public int updateDecrease(int livesDown)
Checks to see if current number of lives is above zero so that decreasing lives will change nothing if lives are equal to zero. If lives are above zero then the number of lives can and will be decreased (by specified amount) upon running of method. Runs updateImage() method to reconfigure number of hearts to match number of lives.

Parameters:
livesDown - Needs to be inputted when running the method. Determines how many lives to subtract.
Returns:
int Returns number of lives as an integer (after subtraction), otherwise returns 0.

updateImage

public void updateImage()
Creates a base image for the hearts (representing lives) to be placed onto Sets background and border (of bar) to white so it is invisible. Creates a hearts object that stores the image for hearts. Uses a for loop to draw the hearts onto the base image accurate to a properly formatted size. Runs setImage() method (Greenfoot built in) to set the base image to have the right number of hearts on top of it.

updateImageTwo

public void updateImageTwo()
Creates a base image for the potions (representing mana) to be placed onto. Sets background and border (of bar) to white so it is invisible. Creates a potions object that stores the image for potions. Uses a for loop to draw the potions onto the base image accurate to a properly formatted size. Runs setImage() method (Greenfoot built in) to set the base image to have the right number of potions on top of it.

updateIncrease

public int updateIncrease(double manaUp)
Checks to see if current amount of mana is below fifteen so that increasing mana will change nothing if mana is equal to fifteen already (max amount). If mana is below fifteen then the amount of mana can and will be increased (by specified amount) upon running of method. Runs updateImageTwo() method to reconfigure number of potions to match amount of mana.

Parameters:
manaUp - Needs to be inputted when running the method. Determines how much mana to add.
Returns:
int Returns amount of mana as an integer (after addition), otherwise returns 15.

updateIncrease

public int updateIncrease(int livesUp)
Checks to see if current number of lives is below fifteen so that increasing lives will change nothing if lives are equal to fifteen already (max amount). If lives are below fifteen then the number of lives can and will be increased (by specified amount) upon running of method. Runs updateImage() method to reconfigure number of hearts to match number of lives.

Parameters:
livesUp - Needs to be inputted when running the method. Determines how many lives to add.
Returns:
int Returns number of lives as an integer (after addition), otherwise returns 15.
